meanings.definition: To grow again after being cut or damaged.
meanings.sent1: The plant regrown quickly after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The grass regrown in the garden after the lawnmower passed.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally cut my hair too short, but luckily it regrown in time for the party.
meanings.sent4: The forest regrown like a green blanket covering the land.
meanings.sent5: The flowers regrown with vibrant colors, bringing life back to the garden.

meanings.sent1: The regrown tree stood tall and proud in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The regrown leaves shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: His regrown hair was a different shade than before, making him look younger.
meanings.sent4: The regrown field was a patchwork of different shades of green.
meanings.sent5: The regrown limb of the tree twisted in a unique pattern, showing its resilience.
